assets.altText: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy and former French prime minister and incumbent President of the Constitutional Council, Laurent Fabius pose...
assets.title: FRANCE-POLITICS-RELIGION-RACISM-PALESTINIAN-ISRAEL-CONFLICT-DEMO
assets.caption: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy (Front L) and former French prime minister and incumbent President of the Constitutional Council, Laurent Fabius  pose for a photograph on the front steps of the Assemblee Nationale parliament building in Paris ahead of a demonstration against anti-Semitism in Paris, on November 12, 2023. Tens of thousands are expected to march Sunday in Paris against anti-Semitism amid bickering by political parties over who should take part and a surge in anti-Semitic incidents across France. Tensions have been rising in the French capital, home to large Jewish and Muslim communities, in the wake of the October 7 attack by Palestinian militant group Hamas on Israel, followed by a month of Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip. France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the attack. National Assembly speaker Yael Braun-Pivet and Gerard Larcher, the Senate speaker, called on November 7 for a "general mobilisation" at the march against the upsurge in anti-Semitism. (Photo by Thomas SAMSON / POOL / AFP) (Photo by THOMAS SAMSON/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)

Tensions have been rising in the French capital, home to large Jewish and Muslim communities, in the wake of the October 7 attack by Palestinian militant group Hamas on Israel, followed by a month of Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip. France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the attack. National Assembly speaker Yael Braun-Pivet and Gerard Larcher, the Senate speaker, called on November 7 for a "general mobilisation" at the march against the upsurge in anti-Semitism.

assets.title: ISRAEL-PALESTINIAN-CONFLICT
assets.caption: This picture taken on November 12, 2023 from a position along the border with the Gaza Strip in southern Israel shows a smoke plume erupting during Israeli bombardment on the Palestinian enclave amid ongoing battles. More than 10,000 people have been killed in relentless Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip, according to the Hamas-run health ministry, since the war erupted after Palestinian militants raided southern Israel on October 7 killing at least 1200 people, according to official Israeli figures. (Photo by FADEL SENNA / AFP) (Photo by FADEL SENNA/AFP via Getty Images)

assets.caption: Activists of Majlis Wahdat-e-Muslimeen (MWM), a Pakistani Shiite political organization, shout slogans as they take part in a rally to express their solidarity with Palestinians in Islamabad on November 12, 2023. Thousands of civilians, both Palestinians and Israelis, have died since October 7, 2023, after Palestinian Hamas militants based in the Gaza Strip entered southern Israel in an unprecedented attack triggering a war declared by Israel on Hamas with retaliatory bombings on Gaza. assets.localizedCaption: French far-right party Rassemblement National (RN) member of Parliament Marine Le Pen (C), President of French far-right party Rassemblement National (RN) Jordan Bardella (R) and French Far-right Rassemblement National (RN) party's MP Sebastien Chenu (L) march during a demonstration against anti-Semitism in Paris, on November 12, 2023. Tens of thousands are expected to march Sunday in Paris against anti-Semitism amid bickering by political parties over who should take part and a surge in anti-Semitic incidents across France. Tensions have been rising in the French capital, home to large Jewish and Muslim communities, in the wake of the October 7 attack by Palestinian militant group Hamas on Israel, followed by a month of Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip. France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the attack. assets.caption: JERUSALEM - NOVEMBER 12:  Pigeons fly outside the near deserted historic Al-Aqsa Mosque on November 12, 2023 in Jerusalem. Al-Aqsa Mosque, the third-holiest site in Islam, stands in a spot known to Jews as Temple Mount, the holiest site in Judaism. Israeli authorities have largely restricted access to Al-Aqsa Mosque compound following the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas, the Palestinian militant group that governs the Gaza Strip. (Photo by Christopher Furlong/Getty Images)

Israeli authorities have largely restricted access to Al-Aqsa Mosque compound following the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas, the Palestinian militant group that governs the Gaza Strip. (Photo by Christopher Furlong/Getty Images)

assets.altText: French far-right party Rassemblement National member of Parliament Marine Le Pen , President of French far-right party Rassemblement National Jordan...
assets.title: FRANCE-POLITICS-RELIGION-RACISM-PALESTINIAN-ISRAEL-CONFLICT-DEMO
assets.caption: French far-right party Rassemblement National (RN) member of Parliament Marine Le Pen (C), President of French far-right party Rassemblement National (RN) Jordan Bardella (R) and French Far-right Rassemblement National (RN) party's MP Sebastien Chenu (L) march during a demonstration against anti-Semitism in Paris, on November 12, 2023. Tens of thousands are expected to march Sunday in Paris against anti-Semitism amid bickering by political parties over who should take part and a surge in anti-Semitic incidents across France. Tensions have been rising in the French capital, home to large Jewish and Muslim communities, in the wake of the October 7 attack by Palestinian militant group Hamas on Israel, followed by a month of Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip. France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the attack. National Assembly speaker Yael Braun-Pivet and Gerard Larcher, the Senate speaker, called on November 7 for a "general mobilisation" at the march against the upsurge in anti-Semitism. (Photo by Geoffroy Van der Hasselt / AFP) (Photo by GEOFFROY VAN DER HASSELT/AFP via Getty Images)

assets.seoCaption: French Senate President Gerard Larcher , President of the French National Assembly Yael Braun-Pivet , surrounded by French Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne , France's former President Nicolas Sarkozy , France's former President Francois Hollande , Chief Rabbi of France Haim Korsia and Bishop of Nanterre monseigneur Matthieu Rouge sing the French national anthem as they stand behind a banner which reads as "For The Republic, Against anti-Semistism" during a march against anti-semitism in Paris, on November 12, 2023. Tens of thousands are expected to march Sunday in Paris against anti-Semitism amid bickering by political parties over who should take part and a surge in anti-Semitic incidents across France. Tensions have been rising in the French capital, home to large Jewish and Muslim communities, in the wake of the October 7 attack by Palestinian militant group Hamas on Israel, followed by a month of Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip. France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the attack. National Assembly speaker Yael Braun-Pivet and Gerard Larcher, the Senate speaker, called on November 7 for a "general mobilisation" at the march against the upsurge in anti-Semitism.

assets.title: ISRAEL-PALESTINIAN-CONFLICT
assets.caption: This picture taken on November 12, 2023 from a position along the border with the Gaza Strip in southern Israel shows an Israeli tank and a plume of smoke erupting during Israeli bombardment on the Palestinian enclave amid ongoing battles. More than 10,000 people have been killed in relentless Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip, according to the Hamas-run health ministry, since the war erupted after Palestinian militants raided southern Israel on October 7 killing at least 1200 people, according to official Israeli figures. (Photo by FADEL SENNA / AFP) (Photo by FADEL SENNA/AFP via Getty Images)
